Subjects: women, warning to; women, as speakers/narrators; dialogues, lovers’
_description: The Notbrowne Mayde — in 18-line stanzas or 6-line stanzas with alternating refrains, ‘He is a banysshed man’ and ‘She loved but hym alone’

OxfBal354.First Lines: Be it right or wrongeThes men amonge…
OxfBal354.Last Lines:
…Moche more owght theyto god obey& serue but hym
                    alon
OxfBal354.Attributed Title:
The Nutbrown mayde (p. 440); Here endith þe nutbrown mayde (p.
                    446)
OxfBal354.Facsimiles:
Early Manuscripts at Oxford University: Facsimile
                    of Oxford, Balliol MS 354.
         (http://image.ox.ac.uk/show?collection=balliol&manuscript=ms354).
